page.title: 06LANHERNE CONVENT
page.content: The Carmelite nuns of Lanherne Convent belong to a closed order. When l went to interview them on 3.7.85 a wall separated us and we spoke through grids. The Reverend Mother said that the house was mentioned in the Domesday Book of 1066. The convent was founded on 1.5.1519, before this the Arundell family lived there. The convent has 32 rooms and a chapel which houses the skull of the martyr St.Cuthbert Mayne. There are 12 acres of convent land and a convent farm of 70 acres. There are 12 nuns in the convent and their day starts at 5.30am and ends at 10.30pm.Most of the day is spent in prayer although each nun has housework to do. The nuns live in total isolation,a lifestyle very different to most people in 1985,committed to their Catholic Religion.
